title: Asian stocks dip, gold hits record as tariff woes return
summary: Markets reacted negatively as US President Donald Trump proposed new tariffs on eight European nations. This move revived tariff concerns, causing risk assets to slip and safe-haven demand to strengthen. Gold and silver prices surged to record highs. Equity futures slumped, and the dollar weakened.

title: What Tiger Global ruling means for foreign investors
summary: A Supreme Court ruling impacts foreign investors in India. Investors can no longer use only a Tax Residency Certificate for tax benefits. Tax authorities will now examine the business substance of overseas investment structures. This affects private equity and other foreign portfolio investors, particularly those using Mauritius and Singapore.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session

title: China's tech stock boom pushes past economic malaise
summary: China's tech sector is experiencing a significant rally in early 2026, driven by advancements in AI, commercial rockets, robotics, and flying cars. This surge in homegrown technologies is outperforming global benchmarks, fueled by investor optimism about China's ambition to lead in AI and high-level chips, even amidst economic fragilities.

title: Sun Pharma looks to rise in US with $10 billion Organon buy
summary: India's largest drugmaker, Sun Pharma, is considering a major acquisition. The company is evaluating the purchase of US-based Organon, a specialist in women's health. This potential deal is valued at around $10 billion. A successful acquisition would be a significant move for Sun Pharma, strengthening its presence in the US market.

title: Priority sector lending: RBI asks HDFC, ICICI banks to make extra provisions
summary: ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank have been instructed by a regulator to make significant one-time provisions. ICICI Bank must set aside an additional Rs 1,283 crore, while HDFC Bank is required to allocate Rs 500 crore. The regulator has also urged both banks to identify and address shortcomings in their loan portfolios. These adjustments are necessary to ensure compliance with Priority Sector Lending (PSL) norms.

title: India needs to narrow the insurance protection gap: Swiss Re
summary: India's total property exposure is now estimated at $26-29 trillion, according to a global reinsurer. A significant portion of this exposure is located in areas prone to natural disasters. These regions are characterized by a high concentration of economic assets that coincide with risks such as floods, cyclones, and earthquakes.

title: Cutting risk cuts microfin's portfolio, recovery way off
summary: Microfinance loan portfolios have been declining since April 2024, according to industry leaders. This trend began after reaching a high of Rs 3.43 lakh crore. The decrease is attributed to loan repayments exceeding new loan disbursements across the sector.

title: Railways stocks: Will this budget put them back on track? 8 stocks from the railways ecosystem, some where analysts are bullish & bearish
summary: Dalal Street often has typical cycles ahead of major events. Till a few years back, when a separate railway budget was presented, some railways-related stocks used to see a bullish build-up a few days before budget day. Then, on the day of the budget itself, they would see a spike – only to lose all the gains the very next day. And the cycle repeated the next year. This especially involved companies making anti-collision systems or laying railway tracks. Now that there is no separate budget, how will railways-related stocks behave?

summary: According to the stock market holiday calendar, the US stock market's New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq Stock Market will be closed today on account of Martin Luther King, Jr. Day.

summary: Shadowfax Technologies IPO opens for subscription on January 20, aiming to raise  ₹1,907.3 crore. The price band is set between  ₹118 to  ₹124 per share. The listing is expected on January 28, with 75% of shares allocated for qualified institutional buyers.

title: Budget 2026: From auto, telecom, railways to defence - Morgan Stanley points out key reforms needed in various sectors
summary: Budget 2026: Morgan Stanley expects the government to target the fiscal deficit at 4.2% of GDP in FY27 as compared with the target of 4.4% of GDP in FY26. This will likely be the shallowest pace of consolidation since FY23.

title: Silver smashes through Rs 3 lakh, ETFs jump 30% this year. Should you sell or wait for bigger target price?
summary: Silver prices surged sharply, with MCX silver futures crossing Rs 3 lakh per kg after a 5% jump, driven by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions sparked by US President Trump’s Greenland bid and tariff threats on Europe. Silver is up about 30% so far in 2026.

title: InfoBeans Technologies board to meet on January 22 to consider bonus issue

title: Gifting money to NRI daughter-in-law: What is the tax implication in India?
summary: Under Indian tax law, if a resident father-in-law gifts a sum of money to his daughter-in-law who is an NRI, the gift is not taxable in India, either in the hands of the donor or the recipient.

title: Weekly Top Picks: These stocks scored 10 on 10 on Stock Reports Plus

An average score in Stock Reports Plus is calculated by undertaking quantitative analysis of five key investment tools – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum.

title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of more than 25%
summary: The markets have been in a corrective phase for some time. When corrections are sparked by global events, they may be short time-wise, but strong in terms of magnitude. If, however, they are caused by local economic factors, they can last longer in terms of time and also cause greater price damage. It is a global factor that is impacting more at this point of time. So, focus on the underlying developments taking place in different sectors and look at the quality of the management before investing. And one more important thing: Be selective.
